titlestmt.titleproper: Henry W. Peterson collection of Reed and Forde manuscripts 1785-1801
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Henry W. Peterson collection of Reed and Forde manuscripts

bioghist.p: John Reed and Standish Forde were Philadelphia merchants. The firm helped to open up trade between the United States and Spanish America, specifically in New Orleans.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of manuscripts, dating from 1785 to 1801, apparently related to the mercantile firm Reed and Forde. Materials include an index to an account book (only one page of which is present); notes about accounts; and a list of balances due. The list of balances due notes ships owned by Reed and Forde that were captured by the French (the brig Molly and the schooner Ulalia).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Independence Seaport Museum: Reed and Forde records; Independence Seaport Museum: J. Claghorn business papers; Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Reed and Forde papers, 1759-1823 (PHi)541
